intro: Poa irrigata f. rigens, commonly known as the rigid poa, is a variant of the irrigated poa species. It is a perennial grass native to certain regions of South America. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its foliage is characterized by stiff, upright blades and compact growth habit. Botanically, it is distinguished by its dense inflorescence and small, spike-like flowers.
